document.masterDocTitle: A revision of Cissidium Motschulsky (Coleoptera: Ptiliidae) with seventy seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of Cissidium Motschulsky (Coleoptera: Ptiliidae) with seventy seven new species

heading.emphasis: Key to species in species group 2

keyStep.keyLead: 1. Species in which the mesocoxal borders are clearly separated ......................................................... 2
– Species with united mesocoxal borders (join sometimes obscured by longer keels) ........................ 8

5. Anterior angles of mid-keel rounded not reaching collar......................................
C. pinense
sp. nov.

– Anterior angles of mid-keel broad reaching collar ...........................................
C. amieuense
sp. nov.

– Keel setose and parallel-sided at base then smooth to tip ...................................
C. riparium
sp. nov.

7. Keel broad with rectangular tip ..........................................................
C. subfoveolatum Darby, 2019

– Keel narrower with slightly rounded tip.................................................
C. matthewsi Johnson, 2007

10. Keel broadening and rounded posteriorly............................................................
C. logunovi
sp. nov.

– All the pronotal foveae more or less round ............................................................
C. clareae
sp. nov.

13. Pronotal sides distinctly concave before hind angles, sides more sharply rounded ( Fig. 28C ) .......... ....................................................................................................................
C. inexspectatum
sp. nov.
– Pronotal sides shallowly concave, almost straight, before hind angles........................................... 14

16. Median process of collar long, keel narrow and pointed.................................
C. montanum
sp. nov.

– Median process of collar very short, keel wider.................................
C. okuense Grebennikov, 2009

17. Head with a distinct fovea between the eyes .........................................
C. foveolatum Johnson 1982

18. Elytra appearing almost parallel-sided ................................................
C. ishigakiense Sawada, 2008

– Pronotal foveae larger two medial ones elongate ......................................
C. aristophanousi
sp. nov.

20. Species with only one or two pronotal foveae...................................................
C. delicatum
sp. nov.
21. Species with a short border along part of the posterior edge of the pronotum................................ 22

22. Pronotum with two large basal foveae..........................................................
C. bifoveolatum
sp. nov.

– Pronotum with four smaller basal foveae ...............................................................
C. yoruba
sp. nov.

24. Posterior angles of mid-keel with carinae to mesocoxal borders .....................
C ceylonicum
sp. nov.

25. Sides of pronotum straight, parallel-sided before hind angles ............................
C. houailou
sp. nov.

26. Medial process of collar onto mid keel almost reaching to basal tip..................
C. misellum
sp. nov.

28. Pronotum with eight foveae across the basal margin ..............................................
C. rogeri
sp. nov.

– Pronotum with four foveae across the basal margin................................................
C. deanei
sp. nov.

31. Keel long, parallel-sided, without pubescence .......................................
C. scutellaris ( Deane, 1931 )

32. Front angles of mid-keel not reaching collar, keel sharply pointed..................
C. davaoense
sp. nov.

– Keel narrow, parallel-sided, foveolate ...............................................................
C. lamington
sp. nov.
